net.sf.JRecord.IO

Class CobolIoProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.JRecord.IO.CobolIoProvider

  • public class CobolIoProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class Creates a line-reader or line-writer for a Cobol file (Cobol Copybook). 
     Usage:
   
        CobolIoProvider ioProvider = CobolIoProvider.getInstance();

        try {
             AbstractLineReader reader  = ioProvider.getLineReader(
                 Constants.IO_TEXT_LINE, ICopybookDialects.FMT_INTEL,
                 CopybookLoader.SPLIT_NONE, copybookName, vendorFile
             );
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

    • Method Detail

      • newIOBuilder

        public ICobolIOBuilder newIOBuilder(java.lang.String copybookFileame)
        Create a new Mainframe-Cobol IOBulder for a file.
        Parameters:
        copybookFileame - name of the Copybook (or schema file).
        Returns:
        requested IOBuilder

      • newIOBuilder

        public ICobolIOBuilder newIOBuilder(java.lang.String copybookFilename,
                           int cobolDialect)
        Create a new Cobol IOBulder for a file.
        Parameters:
        copybookFilename - name of the Copybook (or schema file).
        cobolDialect - Cobol Dialect. Values include:
        • ICopybookDialects.FMT_MAINFRAME - Mainframe cobol
        • ICopybookDialects.FMT_GNU_COBOL - GNU cobol
        • ICopybookDialects.FMT_FUJITSU - Old Free Fujitsu Cobol 3.
        These are the default values (which can be overriden with the appropriate set* method
        Returns:
        requested IOBuilder

      • newIOBuilder

        public ICobolIOBuilder newIOBuilder(java.io.InputStream cobolCopybookStream,
                           java.lang.String copybookName)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new Mainframe-Cobol IOBulder for a file.
        Parameters:
        cobolCopybookStream - stream to read the Cobol Copybook from
        copybookName - name of the Cobol-Copybook.
        Returns:
        requested IOBuilder
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • newIOBuilder

        public ICobolIOBuilder newIOBuilder(java.io.InputStream cobolCopybookStream,
                           java.lang.String copybookName,
                           int cobolDialect)
        Create a new Cobol IOBulder for a file.
        Parameters:
        cobolCopybookStream - stream to read the Cobol Copybook from
        copybookName - name of the Cobol-Copybook.
        cobolDialect - Cobol Dialect. Values include:
        • ICopybookDialects.FMT_MAINFRAME - Mainframe cobol
        • ICopybookDialects.FMT_GNU_COBOL - GNU Cobol
        • ICopybookDialects.FMT_FUJITSU - Old Free Fujitsu Cobol 3.
        These are the default values (which can be over-ridden with the appropriate set* method
        Returns:
        requested IOBuilder

      • getLineReader

        public AbstractLineReader getLineReader(int fileStructure,
                               int numericType,
                               int splitOption,
                               int copybookFormat,
                               java.lang.String copybookName,
                               java.lang.String filename)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Note: This is part of the "old JRecord Interface". Most users will be better off using JRecordInterface1.COBOL to create IIOBuilder classes or the newIOBuilder(String)} Creates a line reader for a Cobol file
        Parameters:
        fileStructure - Structure of the input file
        numericType - Numeric Format data (options include mainframe, Fujitu, PC compiler etc)
        splitOption - Option to split the copybook up
        • No Split
        • Split on redefine
        • Split on 01 level
        copybookName - Copybook (or Layout) name
        filename - input file name
        Returns:
        requested Line Reader
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLineReader

        public AbstractLineReader getLineReader(int fileStructure,

      • getLineReader

        public AbstractLineReader getLineReader(int fileStructure,
                               int numericType,
                               int splitOption,
                               java.lang.String copybookName,
                               java.lang.String filename,
                               LineProvider provider)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Note: This is part of the "old JRecord Interface". Most users will be better off using JRecordInterface1.COBOL to create IIOBuilder classes or the newIOBuilder(String)} Creates a line reader for a Cobol file
        Parameters:
        fileStructure - Structure of the input file
        numericType - Numeric Format data (is mainframe, Fujitu PC compiler etc)
        splitOption - Option to split the copybook up
        • No Split
        • Split on redefine
        • Split on 01 level
        copybookName - Copybook (or Layout) name
        filename - input file name
        provider - line provider (to build your own lines)
        Returns:
        requested Line Reader
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLineReader

        public AbstractLineReader getLineReader(int fileStructure,
                               int numericType,
                               int splitOption,
                               int copybookFormat,
                               java.lang.String copybookName,
                               java.lang.String filename,
                               LineProvider provider)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Note: This is part of the "old JRecord Interface". Most users will be better off using JRecordInterface1.COBOL to create IIOBuilder classes or the newIOBuilder(String)} Creates a line reader for a Cobol file
        Parameters:
        fileStructure - Structure of the input file
        numericType - Numeric Format data (is mainframe, Fujitu PC compiler etc)
        splitOption - Option to split the copybook up
        • No Split
        • Split on redefine
        • Split on 01 level
        copybookFormat - format of the copybook e.g. Cb2xmlConstants.USE_*
        copybookName - Copybook (or Layout) name
        filename - input file name
        provider - line provider (to build your own lines)
        Returns:
        requested Line Reader
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLineWriter

        @Deprecated
public AbstractLineWriter getLineWriter(int fileStructure,
                                          java.lang.String outputFileName)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Note: This is part of the "old JRecord Interface". Most users will be better off using JRecordInterface1.COBOL to create IIOBuilder classes or the newIOBuilder(String)} Create a line writer for a Cobol File
        Parameters:
        fileStructure - structure of the output file
        Returns:
        Line writer for the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getLineWriter

        public AbstractLineWriter getLineWriter(IBasicFileSchema schema,
                               java.lang.String outputFileName)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Note: This is part of the "old JRecord Interface". Most users will be better off using JRecordInterface1.COBOL to create IIOBuilder classes or the newIOBuilder(String)} Create a line writer for a Cobol File
        Parameters:
        schema - File-Schema (or file definition)
        outputFileName - name of the file to be written
        Returns:
        Line writer for the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
